title: BAIDU, INC. (NASDAQ: BIDU) SHAREHOLDER CLASS ACTION ALERT:
summary: Bernstein Liebhard LLP has announced a securities class action lawsuit against Baidu Inc. (NASDAQ: BIDU) on behalf of investors who purchased securities between March 22, 2021, and March 29, 2021. The lawsuit alleges that Goldman Sachs Group Inc. and Morgan Stanley unlawfully traded Baidu shares using non-public information related to Archegos Capital Management's margin call failure, causing losses for Baidu investors. Investors are invited to join the lawsuit, with a lead plaintiff deadline of February 14, 2022.

title: Baidu Brings Apollo Go Robotaxi Service to Downtown Shenzhen, Expanding Presence to All First-tier Cities in China
summary: Baidu's Apollo Go robotaxi service has launched trial operations in Shenzhen's Nanshan District, making Shenzhen the seventh city in China to offer the service. This expansion marks Baidu's presence in all first-tier cities in China and highlights its goal to accelerate the development of intelligent transportation. Baidu aims to expand Apollo Go operations to 65 cities by 2025 and 100 cities by 2030, offering autonomous ride-hailing to a wider user base.

title: Baidu Inc continues to grow and invest in R&D
summary: Baidu Inc reported a 1 percent year-on-year revenue increase to 28.4 billion yuan in Q1, with a non-GAAP net profit of 3.9 billion yuan, and continues heavy investment in R&D, which rose 10 percent to 5.6 billion yuan. The company's cloud and intelligent driving businesses, particularly Apollo Go, show strong growth despite COVID-19 related impacts. Baidu has also secured permits for driverless robotaxis in Beijing and Chongqing, highlighting advancements in its AI initiatives.

title: Baidu Granted China's First-Ever Permits for Commercial Fully Driverless Ride-Hailing Services
summary: Baidu has received China's first-ever permits to operate commercial fully driverless robotaxi services on open roads in Chongqing and Wuhan, allowing the company to collect fares without human safety operators in the vehicles. This milestone marks a significant step for the future of mobility in China, making it the first country globally to allow fared fully driverless robotaxi operation in two megacities. Baidu's Apollo Go, already the world's largest robotaxi service provider, will offer these services during designated daytime hours.

title: Baidu bags China's first fully driverless robotaxi licenses
summary: Baidu has received the first permits in China to operate fully driverless robotaxi services on open roads in Chongqing and Wuhan. These permits allow commercial robotaxis to operate without human safety drivers and mark a significant turning point for autonomous driving policy in China. Baidu plans to deploy a batch of five fee-charging robotaxis in designated areas within each city.

title: Baidu stock surges after announcement of ChatGPT-style AI bot
summary: Baidu's stock surged after the company announced its intention to launch a ChatGPT-style AI chatbot called "Wenxin Yiyan" or "ERNIE Bot" in March. This strategic move highlights the ongoing AI race among tech giants, following Google's announcement of its own chatbot, Bard, and Microsoft's significant investment in OpenAI. Baidu's ERNIE Bot is based on a language model first developed in 2019 and is currently in its third iteration.

title: Baidu's ChatGPT-like app will revolutionise its search engine, says CEO
summary: Baidu's CEO Robin Li announced that its upcoming ChatGPT-like app, Ernie Bot, will revolutionize its search engine by enhancing user experience and engagement, significantly expanding the market size of search engines. The company plans to build an AI ecosystem around Ernie Bot, leveraging its advanced generative AI technology to boost online advertising and serve as a productivity tool for other businesses. Baidu aims to regain market share and capitalize on its "first mover" advantage in China's AI market with Ernie Bot, which is trained on years of search data and is "state of the art" in understanding Chinese language and culture.

title: Demo of China’s Answer to ChatGPT Disappoints Investors
summary: Baidu Inc.'s CEO Robin Li unveiled "Ernie Bot," China's answer to ChatGPT, in a recorded video demonstration that disappointed investors, leading to a 6.4% drop in Baidu's shares. The pre-recorded nature of the demo and lack of real-time interaction raised questions about Ernie's capabilities compared to OpenAI's ChatGPT. Despite the initial disappointment, Baidu is considered a frontrunner in China's AI race, planning to integrate Ernie Bot across its services while navigating concerns about US tech restrictions and Chinese regulatory oversight.

title: Baidu Unveils ERNIE Bot, the Latest Generative AI Mastering Chinese Language and Multi-Modal Generation
summary: Baidu has introduced ERNIE Bot, a new-generation large language model (LLM) and generative AI product. It excels in Chinese language understanding, multi-modal generation, literary creation, business writing, and mathematical calculations. The bot will initially be accessible to invited users and enterprise clients via Baidu AI Cloud.

title: Baidu Wins China Capital City's First-Ever Permit to Provide Fully Driverless Ride-hailing Service
summary: Baidu has received the first-ever permits to provide fully driverless ride-hailing services in Beijing, making it a global pioneer as the first provider of such services in a capital city without human drivers or safety operators. This achievement expands Baidu's fully driverless operations to three major Chinese cities: Beijing, Wuhan, and Chongqing. The company plans to deploy 10 fully driverless vehicles in Beijing and aims to build the world's largest fully driverless ride-hailing area in 2023, leveraging its extensive autonomous driving technology and patent portfolio.

title: Baidu Inc. (BIDU) Stock Sinks As Market Gains: What You Should Know
summary: Baidu Inc. (BIDU) shares fell by 1.89% while the broader market gained, showing underperformance compared to the S&P 500 and Nasdaq. Despite this, analysts project strong earnings growth for Baidu in its upcoming report and for the full year, with the company currently holding a Zacks Rank of #1 (Strong Buy). Its valuation also appears favorable with a Forward P/E of 13.34 compared to its industry average.

title: Apple sued to stop App Store clones of Baidu's Ernie AI chatbot
summary: Baidu has initiated legal action against Apple and various app developers in Beijing, seeking the removal of numerous unauthorized "Ernie bot" applications from the App Store. The Chinese tech giant claims that these apps are fake, as Baidu has not yet released an official application for its Ernie AI chatbot, which is similar to ChatGPT. Baidu has warned users that any Ernie app currently available is counterfeit and has urged caution against selling access codes for the bot.

title: Baidu sues Apple, app developers over fake Ernie bot apps
summary: Baidu has filed lawsuits against app developers and Apple Inc. over counterfeit versions of its AI-powered Ernie bot app appearing on Apple's App Store. The Chinese search engine giant clarified that no official Ernie app currently exists and warned against purchasing access codes. Baidu's Ernie bot, launched last month, is considered China's answer to ChatGPT.

title: Baidu Creates $140 Million Fund to Back ChatGPT-Like Startups
summary: Baidu Inc. has launched a 1 billion yuan ($140 million) fund to support Chinese startups developing generative AI, similar to ChatGPT services. This initiative aims to incubate projects built on Baidu's Ernie AI model, with individual deployments potentially reaching 10 million yuan. Venture capitalists like IDG Capital will assist in evaluating pitches and providing seed funding to promising founders.

title: China supports commercialization of Level-3 autonomous driving technology
summary: China's Ministry of Industry and Information Technology (MIIT) is actively supporting the commercialization of Level-3 and higher autonomous driving technologies, aiming to accelerate innovation through collaboration and infrastructure development. This governmental backing is pushing China to the forefront of autonomous driving development, with a projected market value of $98.89 billion by 2030. Companies like Baidu, which already operates the world's largest autonomous ride-hailing service, are key players in this expansion.

title: Institutions own 40% of Baidu, Inc. (NASDAQ:BIDU) shares but individual investors control 40% of the company
summary: Individual investors and institutional investors each own 40% of Baidu, Inc. (NASDAQ:BIDU) shares, indicating significant influence from the general public. The CEO, Yanhong Li, holds a 20% stake, while the top 25 shareholders collectively own less than 50% of the company, preventing any single individual from having majority control. This ownership structure suggests that despite institutional presence, individual investors can collectively impact company policies.

title: What Happens When You Ask a Chinese Chatbot About Taiwan? (Published 2023)
summary: This article compares the responses of China's Baidu chatbot, Ernie 3.5, and OpenAI's ChatGPT (GPT-4) to a series of questions, particularly those related to sensitive political topics in China like Taiwan, "zero Covid," and the Tiananmen Square protests. While ChatGPT answered controversial questions straightforwardly, Ernie tended to avoid or reshape answers according to the official Chinese stance, sometimes even rebooting when pressed on highly censored subjects. The comparison highlights the differing approaches and limitations of AI models operating within distinct geopolitical and censorship environments.

title: Baidu Showcases Major AI Developments at WAVE SUMMIT 2023: ERNIE Bot Plugins, PaddlePaddle V2.5, and AI Coding Assistant
summary: Baidu announced significant AI developments at WAVE SUMMIT 2023, including an expansion of ERNIE Bot with five new plugins for enhanced functionalities like data analysis and text-to-video conversion. The company also unveiled the upgraded PaddlePaddle deep learning platform (V2.5), the AI-native application InfoFlow, and the Baidu Comate AI coding assistant for enterprise developers. These updates aim to advance artificial general intelligence and boost developer efficiency.

title: Baidu Revenue Beats as ChatGPT-Style AI Awaits Beijing Approval
summary: Baidu Inc. reported a significant revenue increase, its largest in over a year, with sales jumping 15% to 34.1 billion yuan and net income rising 43% to 5.2 billion yuan for the June quarter. This growth follows a relaxation of Beijing's regulations on the private sector and a rebound in advertising. The company's shares rose in pre-market trading, as investors keenly monitor its ChatGPT-style AI, Ernie Bot, which is awaiting government approval.

title: Baidu Inc (NASDAQ: BIDU): Will BIDU Stock Break Out of $150 Mark?
summary: Baidu Inc (NASDAQ: BIDU) stock has been consolidating within a horizontal range of $123.07 and $151.40, with current trading at $142.60. Despite gaining nearly 20% year-to-date and trading above key moving averages, the stock needs increased buying volume to break out above the $150 mark. Technical indicators show mixed signals, with the RSI indicating a downside trend but MACD confirming upward momentum, necessitating investor patience until the stock sustains above the consolidation phase.

title: Chinese tech giant Baidu gets into EV game with Geely
summary: Baidu has partnered with Zhejiang Geely to launch the electric vehicle brand Ji Yue, with its first model, the 01 crossover, revealed in August. Ji Yue vehicles will integrate Baidu's AI and self-driving technologies with Geely's manufacturing expertise, differentiating themselves from U.S. tech companies that have stalled in their automotive ventures. This move signifies Baidu's deeper expansion into the automotive sector beyond its existing robotaxi services.

title: Bernstein Maintains Baidu Inc - ADR (BIDU) Outperform Recommendation
summary: Bernstein has reiterated its Outperform recommendation for Baidu Inc - ADR (BIDU). Analysts project a 38.47% upside for BIDU, with an average one-year price target of $183.27. Institutional ownership remains significant despite a slight decrease in the number of funds holding the stock.

title: Baidu Launches ERNIE 4.0 Foundation Model, Leading a New Wave of AI-Native Applications
summary: Baidu launched its ERNIE 4.0 foundation model, highlighting its dramatically improved performance in understanding, generation, reasoning, and memory. The company showcased how ERNIE 4.0 powers a new wave of AI-native applications, including enhanced versions of Baidu Search, Baidu GBI, Infoflow, Baidu Wenku, Baidu Drive, and Baidu Maps. This advancement aims to drive new innovations and a thriving AI ecosystem, with a focus on enterprise solutions and expanding autonomous driving capabilities.

title: Baidu's AI Chatbot Signifies China Closing Gap with US
summary: Baidu has launched ERNIE 4.0, an AI chatbot it claims rivals OpenAI's GPT-4, signaling China's rapid advancements in generative AI. This development highlights China's significant investments in AI research and talent, challenging the U.S.'s previous dominance in the field. Despite U.S. efforts to restrict chip exports, China's commitment to AI innovation remains strong, with Baidu integrating AI into many of its applications and other Chinese tech giants also unveiling their own models.

title: Tesla (TSLA) Faces Self-Driving Challenge as Geely and Baidu Launch EV Jiyue 01
summary: Geely and Baidu have launched their first electric vehicle, the Jiyue 01, intensifying competition in China's automated-driving market. This new SUV utilizes Baidu's Apollo platform and aims to transition to a pure-vision driving approach, similar to Tesla, eschewing more expensive sensors. Its introduction presents a direct challenge to Tesla's presence in the self-driving EV sector.

title: Geely Holding and Baidu launch new AI-powered EV
summary: Geely Holding Group and Baidu Inc's joint venture has launched its first AI-powered electric vehicle, the Ji Yue 01, priced from 249,900 yuan ($34,151.8). This SUV features Level 4 autonomous driving technology, a voice-activated control system, advanced intelligent cabins, and integrates Baidu's Ernie Bot for an AI interactive experience. The vehicle boasts a range of up to 720 kilometers on a single charge and marks a significant milestone in the partnership formed in March 2021.

title: Jidu launches AI-based robocar in China
summary: Jidu Auto, a joint venture between Geely and Baidu, has launched its first AI-powered battery electric vehicle, the Ji Yue 01, in China. This "robocar" features Baidu's Apollo Level 4 autonomous driving technology and advanced intelligent cockpit systems. Despite cutting-edge technology, the CEO acknowledges the need to build brand awareness to gain significant market share.

title: Baidu CEO warns China's rush to develop AI models risks wasting resources
summary: Baidu CEO Robin Li warned that China's rapid development of large language AI models risks wasting resources, urging companies to focus instead on practical applications. He noted that while many foundational models have been created, there's a significant lack of corresponding AI applications. Li highlighted that 238 large language models were released by October, up from 79 in June, indicating a substantial investment in basic infrastructure that may not yet have clear business models.

title: Baidu Bruised By Markets Skittish About Misleading Newspaper Report
summary: Baidu's stock took a hit after a misleading report from the South China Morning Post suggested the company collaborated with the Chinese military, leading to a $4.68 billion market cap loss. The report, which the newspaper later corrected, wrongly claimed a "physical link" between a military AI system and Baidu's Ernie Bot, when researchers had only used the public model like any other user. This incident highlights the challenges tech companies face with dual-use technologies and national military ties, especially for Chinese firms under scrutiny for potential US sanctions.

title: Baidu Responds to Recent Media Reports on Ernie Bot
summary: Baidu has issued a clarification regarding recent media reports about an academic paper that mentioned its ERNIE Bot alongside other large language models. The company stated that ERNIE Bot is publicly available and was used by the paper's authors like any other generative AI tool, denying any special business collaboration or tailored services provided to them. Baidu also noted that the South China Morning Post, which first reported on the paper, has since clarified its original report.

title: US “will probably sanction” Baidu despite Chinese military AI denials
summary: Baidu is likely to face US sanctions due to reports linking its AI chatbot 'Ernie' to China's People's Liberation Army (PLA). An academic paper from a PLA-affiliated university claimed the PLA tested its large language model on Baidu's Ernie bot, causing Baidu's shares to slump. The US is expected to respond with sanctions and a ban on Baidu products for politicians and military members, similar to actions taken against Huawei.

title: With 40% ownership of the shares, Baidu, Inc. (NASDAQ:BIDU) is heavily dominated by institutional owners
summary: Baidu, Inc. is significantly influenced by institutional investors who own 40% of the shares, impacting the stock price through their trading actions. Additionally, the CEO, Yanhong Li, holds a substantial 20% ownership, indicating strong insider commitment. The general public also has a notable 40% stake, contributing to the company's ownership diversity.

title: Baidu AI Cloud Collaborates with Samsung China: Galaxy AI Integrates ERNIE LLM
summary: Baidu AI Cloud has announced a strategic partnership with Samsung China, integrating Baidu's ERNIE large language model into Samsung's Galaxy AI. This collaboration aims to provide Chinese users with advanced AI features, including translation and content summarization in call and note applications, leveraging Baidu's LLM technology for enhanced productivity and communication. This move signifies the growing trend of integrating generative AI into mobile devices.

title: Baidu feels benefit from AI, Q4 revenue rises 6%
summary: Baidu reported a 6% rise in fourth-quarter revenue, reaching 34.95 billion yuan ($4.92 billion), primarily driven by its generative AI applications. The company is actively monetizing its AI services, including a premium version of Ernie Bot and partnerships to integrate its technology into smartphones. Baidu's adjusted net income saw a significant 44% increase to 7.76 billion yuan, surpassing analyst expectations.

title: After Earnings, Is Baidu Stock a Buy, a Sell, or Fairly Valued?
summary: Baidu released its Q4 earnings, revealing revenue in line with expectations but lower operating margins due to AI project costs and declining advertising revenue. Morningstar maintains a 5-star rating and a $183 fair value estimate, despite near-term macroeconomic and geopolitical risks, seeing long-term potential in Baidu's AI products and cloud services. The company's wide economic moat is attributed to its dominant user base and extensive R&D in AI, though competition and uncertainty around AI monetization remain concerns.

title: Apple’s stock has faltered, but a Steve Jobs moment in AI may be on the horizon
summary: Apple's stock performance has been underwhelming, leading to concerns about its AI capabilities. However, an analyst suggests that Apple CEO Tim Cook might be preparing a "Steve Jobs moment" by announcing an AI app store, similar to how Wall Street initially underestimated the iTunes Store. This could represent a significant play in the artificial intelligence sector, despite previous doubts fueled by reports of Apple discussing AI engines with other tech giants.

title: Baidu Shares Rise After Reports That Apple Will Use Its AI Services in China Products
summary: Baidu's shares increased significantly in Hong Kong following reports that Apple plans to utilize Baidu's AI services for its products in China. The collaboration, which has been the subject of preliminary talks, would make Baidu Apple's local generative AI model provider for the iPhone 16, Mac operating system, and iOS 18. This partnership is pending approval from Chinese regulators for generative AI models.

title: Baidu Create 2024: Empowering Everyone as Creators of the AI Future
summary: Baidu is hosting its annual AI developer conference, Baidu Create 2024, on April 16th in Shenzhen, themed "Create the Future." The event will showcase new ERNIE models and development toolkits, aiming to make AI-native application development more accessible to everyone. Baidu's CEO, Robin Li, will deliver a keynote addressing the integration of general AI capabilities with industry expertise and introducing lightweight models and AI toolkits for non-programmers.

title: Update: Baidu faces intense PR backlash following controversial comments by its PR chief on social media
summary: Baidu's vice president and head of PR, Qu Jing, has reportedly left the company following intense public backlash over controversial comments she made on social media. Her remarks, which criticized employees and showed a lack of empathy, sparked outrage and led to a public apology from Qu. The incident negatively impacted Baidu's stock price and raised questions about corporate culture and employee treatment in large tech companies.

title: After Earnings, Is Baidu Stock a Buy, a Sell, or Fairly Valued?
summary: Baidu's Q1 earnings report shows lingering advertising headwinds, but potential long-term growth driven by generative AI. Morningstar maintains a 4-star "undervalued" rating with a fair value estimate of $174 per share, anticipating AI Cloud and smart driving to be key growth drivers offsetting near-term advertising weakness. The company holds a wide economic moat and strong financial health despite competitive and uncertain AI market risks.

title: Baidu Introduces AI and Agent-Driven Innovations at Annual Mobile Ecosystem Event to Transform Mobile Experience
summary: Baidu unveiled its latest AI and agent-driven innovations at its annual Mobile Ecosystem Group event, integrating large language models and ERNIE agents across its mobile products like Baidu Search, Baidu Wenku, and the Baidu App. These advancements aim to make AI more accessible to individuals and enterprises, enhancing productivity and enabling intelligent transformation. Noteworthy achievements include Baidu Wenku's 100 multimodal AI features used over 1.5 billion times and Baidu AgentBuilder supporting over 160,000 developers and users and 50,000 enterprises across various application scenarios.

title: Tesla upgrades in-car navigation software in China, introduces lane-level guidance
summary: Tesla has released a software upgrade for its in-car navigation system in China, introducing new features like lane-level guidance to reduce reliance on smartphone apps. The upgrade, using Baidu Maps V20, aims to provide more detailed road information and improve driving safety. This enhancement comes as Tesla works to introduce its "Full Self-Driving" software in China, while a more detailed navigation has been a common request from Chinese users.

title: How Safe Are Driverless Cars in China? I Rode in Some to See. (Published 2024)
summary: This article explores the safety of driverless cars in China, highlighting a recent fatal crash of an Aito M7 Plus electric SUV where information was censored. The author, Keith Bradsher, describes the official support and public acceptance of computer-aided driving in China, contrasting it with the lack of transparency around safety incidents. It also draws parallels with safety investigations faced by driverless car companies in the United States.

title: Baidu Gets a Boost on Suggestions Its Robotaxi Business Is Taking Off
summary: Baidu's American Depositary Receipts (ADRs) rose on reports that its Apollo Go robotaxi business is expected to break even in Wuhan this year, according to analyst Li Muhua. The robotaxi service is currently conducting manned tests in 11 Chinese cities and unmanned tests in several others, with operating costs anticipated to fall significantly. The positive outlook for Baidu's autonomous driving efforts is also fueled by the upcoming launch of Tesla's robotaxi in August.

title: Baidu gets grant for autonomous excavation learning method using neural network for trajectory planning
summary: Baidu has received a patent for an autonomous excavation learning method that uses a convolutional neural network to predict excavation success probability. This method involves tiling trajectory parameters across a voxel-grid, combining them with a voxel-grid representation of the excavation scene, and feeding this into a neural network to determine the likelihood of a successful excavation. The system also includes a process for refining trajectory parameters through iterations of sampling and selection, ultimately choosing the trajectory with the highest success probability.

title: Meta faces AI accuracy issues as tech industry tackles hallucinations, deepfakes
summary: Meta is addressing accuracy issues with its AI chatbot, Meta AI, after it incorrectly claimed the assassination attempt on Donald Trump didn't happen and misapplied a fact-checking label to a photo. This comes as other tech giants like Google and Baidu also work on improving AI safety and accuracy, with Google focusing on deepfake removal and Baidu developing a "self-reasoning" mechanism for LLMs. The incidents highlight the ongoing challenges of AI hallucinations and the industry's efforts to mitigate them.

title: Baidu stock dropping on flat revenue, China's econ slowdown
summary: Baidu's stock is falling after the Chinese internet giant reported flat second-quarter revenue, impacted by China's economic downturn and reduced advertising spending. The company is facing challenges as it transitions from search ads to AI, despite some traction with its Ernie large language model. Analysts are questioning how long this transition will take for Baidu to regain momentum.

title: Baidu-backed Chinese autonomous trucking firm expects to be profitable in 2025
summary: Baidu-backed Chinese autonomous driving startup CiDi anticipates achieving profitability in 2025 by focusing on software and services for mining and factory applications. The company, valued at $1.2 billion, is open to an IPO and emphasizes industrial-grade haulage where labor cost savings are significant. Despite potential challenges in overseas expansion due to Western concerns over Chinese technologies, CiDi aims for a double-digit share of the global autonomous mining market by 2030.

title: Baidu rebrands Ernie Bot as Wenxiaoyan in China to stand out from AI rivals
summary: Baidu has rebranded its flagship AI app, Ernie Bot, as "Wenxiaoyan" in China to differentiate itself in the competitive AI market. The new name highlights its function as a "new search" assistant, with Baidu focusing on user value and integrating AI capabilities into various products. The app allows for text, speech, and image-based searches, along with AI functions like text-to-image generation and customized agents.

title: Baidu - The Chinese Google at a Discount
summary: The article analyzes Baidu (BIDU), describing it as "The Chinese Google at a Discount." It notes that recent increases in Chinese stock prices, including Baidu's, are driven by depressed valuations due to geopolitical concerns rather than fundamental improvements. Baidu shows strong technical indicators like a 34.07% increase in the last month and a buy signal from Trend Seeker, alongside a P/E of 11.30 and expected revenue growth, indicating it could be an undervalued opportunity despite volatility.

title: Horizon Robotics Starts IPO, with Investment From Alibaba and Baidu
summary: Horizon Robotics, a Chinese AI chip startup, has initiated its initial public offering (IPO) process. The company has attracted investments from major tech giants Alibaba and Baidu, signaling strong market confidence in its growth potential. This move marks a significant step for Horizon Robotics in its journey to expand its presence in the competitive artificial intelligence sector.

title: It's Time To Buy Baidu Again (NASDAQ:BIDU)
summary: Baidu is considered highly undervalued, especially with potential from its AI/robotaxi segment not yet reflected in its stock price, making it a strong buy around $90. Technical analysis suggests the stock has likely bottomed at $80, offering a prime opportunity to invest below $100, with projections of 40-100% gains in the next year despite competitive and geopolitical risks.

title: Baidu Unveils iRAG and No-Code Tool Miaoda to Drive AI Application Boom
summary: Baidu unveiled new AI technologies at its Baidu World 2024 conference, including iRAG for mitigating image generation hallucinations and Miaoda, a no-code tool for building applications using natural language. The company reported that its ERNIE foundation model now handles 1.5 billion daily API calls, a 30-fold increase year-over-year, and emphasized the growing importance of AI agents in application development. Baidu also announced user growth for ERNIE Bot, increased enterprise application development on its Qianfan platform, and the upcoming launch of Xiaodu AI Glasses.

title: Baidu's Apollo autonomous vehicles granted licence to test in Hong Kong
summary: Baidu's Apollo Go robotaxi service has secured a license to test 10 autonomous vehicles in North Lantau, Hong Kong, marking the company's first known permit for self-driving vehicle testing outside mainland China. The trial, valid from December 2024 to December 2029, will initially operate one vehicle on specified roads with a backup operator. This move is part of Baidu's strategy to expand its autonomous driving technology to international markets like Hong Kong, Singapore, and the Middle East.

title: This Chinese AI Stock Is Preparing for ‘Explosive Growth’ in 2025. Is It Too Late to Buy?
summary: Baidu, often referred to as the "Google of China," is rapidly transforming into an AI powerhouse, with its ERNIE Bot and Apollo autonomous driving platform gaining significant traction. Despite a challenging macroeconomic environment impacting its online marketing revenue, Baidu is heavily investing in AI, reporting strong growth in AI Cloud revenue and high user engagement with its generative AI content. Analysts project substantial sales and earnings growth, with the stock currently valued at an attractive multiple, suggesting significant upside potential.

title: Baidu Stock Falls After Earnings. Advertising Slump Eclipses AI Boost.
summary: Baidu's stock fell due to a slowdown in advertising spending, which overshadowed any potential boost from its AI initiatives. The Chinese search-engine provider's quarterly revenue was negatively impacted, leading to a 13% decline in its stock over the past year in Hong Kong.

title: Baidu Stock Slips After Dip In Advertising Revenue Overshadows Q4 Earnings Beat: Retail’s Still Impressed
summary: Baidu's stock (BIDU) declined despite beating Q4 2024 earnings estimates, primarily due to a 7% drop in advertising revenue, which overshadowed its overall financial performance. The company's CEO, Robin Li, highlighted a strategic shift towards an AI-first business, with strong growth in AI Cloud and its Apollo Go robotaxi service. Despite the stock slip, retail sentiment on platforms like Stocktwits remained "extremely bullish," with some investors considering the stock undervalued given its AI advancements.

title: Baidu's Stock Slides as AI Gains Fail to Offset Concerns Over Revenue Drop
summary: Baidu's shares dropped following its latest earnings report, which showed strong growth in its AI and cloud computing businesses but a third consecutive quarterly decline in overall revenue, impacting investor sentiment. While non-online marketing revenue, driven by AI cloud, surged, traditional online marketing income decreased, leading to a slight annual revenue decline. Despite this, Baidu remains optimistic about its AI investments, with analysts forecasting growth in its AI cloud segments and eventual commercialization of AI search.

title: Here's What Analysts Are Forecasting For Baidu, Inc. (NASDAQ:BIDU) After Its Annual Results
summary: Baidu Inc. shares fell 7.2% after its annual results, despite beating EPS expectations. Analysts expect Baidu's revenue to increase by 3.1% in 2025 to CN¥137.3 billion, while EPS is predicted to decline by 11% to CN¥60.62. The consensus among analysts remains largely unchanged, with no major adjustments to revenue or earnings estimates, and the price target holding at US$110.

title: Baidu Stock Lags Despite China’s AI Surge
summary: Despite a surge in China's AI sector driven by models like DeepSeek, Baidu's stock has underperformed its peers like Alibaba and Tencent, rising only about 6% compared to their significant gains. Baidu's struggles are attributed to China's weak post-COVID-19 economic recovery impacting advertising revenue, although its AI cloud division shows strong growth. The company is investing heavily in AI technologies such as Ernie Bot and self-driving, and its stock is considered fairly valued at under 9x consensus 2025 earnings, presenting potential upside as economic stimulus measures take effect.

title: Baidu releases reasoning AI model to take on DeepSeek
summary: Baidu has launched its new Ernie X1 reasoning AI model and upgraded its flagship foundation model to Ernie 4.5, making all tiers of its service free for chatbot users. The company aims to compete with rivals like DeepSeek, whose R1 model demonstrated strong performance at a low cost, and plans to open-source its Ernie AI models from June 30. This strategic shift follows increased competition and reflects Baidu's efforts to reassert its position in the rapidly evolving AI landscape, with an investment of $1.6 billion into AI and cloud infrastructure from a recent acquisition.

title: Baidu Stock Jumps as Chinese Market Leaves U.S. in Its Dust
summary: Baidu's stock surged after the company introduced a new artificial intelligence model, contributing to a broader rally in the Chinese stock market. This contrasts with the performance of U.S. equities, highlighting the momentum building in China. Baidu's AI development is attracting significant investor attention.

title: Baidu shares jump 10% following release of new free-to-use AI models
summary: Baidu's shares increased by 10.7% after the release of two new AI models, including an updated "Ernie" model and a reasoning model competitive with DeepSeek's R1. This move is seen as Baidu's effort to regain leadership in China's AI sector, especially since the new models are free for individual users, a shift from their previous subscription-based approach. Analysts suggest this could help Baidu solidify its technology as an industry standard and expand its market share.

title: Delisting Chinese Stocks Like Alibaba and Baidu Is a Real Possibility for Trump
summary: The article discusses the real possibility of former President Donald Trump delisting major Chinese stocks such as Alibaba and Baidu from American stock exchanges amidst the escalating U.S.-China trade war. This move could have significant implications for these companies, which have already seen their stock prices fall due to the trade tensions. The potential delisting highlights the broader risks and stakes involved for Chinese companies trading on U.S. markets.

title: Baidu number 1 in AI patent applications
summary: Baidu Inc. has cemented its position as a leader in AI patent applications and authorizations in China, topping the domestic list for seven consecutive years.
